title.narrative: FLC/LCDZ: Young Voices Disability Rights Advocacy Project

description.narrative: Leonard Cheshire Disability Zimbabwe (LCDZ) is a non-political Zimbabwean registered disability welfare organization. The mission of the organization is to enable children and youth with disabilities to improve their quality of life and to campaign for the removal of the barriers which hinder them. The overall goal of this project is ?Improved human rights and participation of people with disabilities in social economic and political spheres in Zimbabwe. This will be achieved through contributing to the imp lementation and monitoring of the UNCRPD and disability commitments in the Constitution of Zimbabwe. In doing so the project will strengthen the capacities of young people with disabilities to be active citizens who can participate fully in civil society a ction and in decision making. The project operates with Young Voices groups of disabled youth by informing them on and including them in processes that regard the implementation of their rights. The activities include eg. participation and contributions to the State Party Report on UNCRPD production of the translated UNCRPD in accessible formats and organizing dialogues with policy makers.
